thread.title: Australian shares off to brisk start
thread.title_full: Australian shares off to brisk start

title: Australian shares off to brisk start
text:
Mon, Oct 5, 2015, 11:10 AM AEDT - Australia Markets close in 4 hrs 50 mins Australian shares off to brisk start AAP – 23 minutes ago Print 
The Australian share market has got off to a brisk start, as investors take cues from solid gains in the US and European markets on Friday, despite disappointing US jobs data. 
The benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was up more than 1.5 per cent in the first half hour of trade, on the back of gains in the big miners and banking stocks. 
"Traders are betting that the (US) Federal Reserve will likely delay the interest rate increase," Australian Stocks Report's head of research and trading Chris Conway said. 
"The Fed said they will be data-driven, and this data shows things have deteriorated. An October hike seems to be off the table," he added. 
On Friday, Wall Street stocks climbed despite a report showing that the United States added just 142,000 jobs in September, well below expectations. The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed 1.2 per cent higher. 
In the local market, volumes are expected to be lower on account of a public holiday in NSW. 
"Whether or not these gains can be sustained, we will have to see, but we should end higher," Mr Conway said. 
Shares in mining stocks led the gains on Monday. BHP Billiton was up 80 cents, or 3.5 per cent to $23.40, while rival Rio Tinto added $1.12 to $49.85. Gold producer Newcrest Mining was trading 88 cents, or 7.0 per cent higher at $13.52. 
The big four banks also held up the momentum. Commonwealth Bank was up $1.07 to $74.46, Westpac added 40 cents at $30.15, NAB gained 47 cents to $30.57 and ANZ rose 30 cents at $27.23. 
Meanwhile, data showed that services sector activity has risen for the fourth month in a row, helped by the falling Australian dollar and record low interest rates. 
KEY FACTS 
* At 1035 AEDT on Monday, the benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was up 82 points, or 1.61 per cent, at 5,134 points. 
* The broader All Ordinaries index was up 78 points, or 1.53 per cent, at 5,167 points. 
* The December share price index futures contract was up 83 points at 5,114 points, with 10,248 contracts traded. 
* National turnover was 207.76 million securities worth $356.85 million. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Aust shares open higher AAP 
The Australian share market has opened one per cent higher. At 1010 AEDT on Monday, the benchmark S&P/ASX200 index …
